meanings.def: a long, narrow piece of material with a sticky substance on one side that is used for sticking things together
examples: adhesive/sticky tape
Fit the carpet using double-sided tape.

meanings.def: a long, thin piece of magnetic material, used for recording sounds, pictures or information, especially before digital technology became available
examples: on tape Twenty years ago he was caught on tape in a very embarrassing situation.
I have all my school concert performances recorded on tape.

meanings.def: a cassette that contains sounds, or sounds and pictures, that have been recorded
examples: a blank tape (= a tape with nothing recorded on it)
Someone had deliberately erased the tapes.
The singer was miming to a pre-recorded tape.
The tape contained damning evidence.
What does this tape have on it?
Police seized various books and tapes.

meanings.def: a narrow piece of material that is used for tying things together or as a label
examples: The papers were in a pile, tied together with a tape.

meanings.def: a long, thin piece of material that is stretched across the place where a race will finish or used to mark off an area
examples: the finishing tape
Police tape cordoned off the street in front of the house.

meanings.def: a long thin piece of plastic, cloth or flexible metal that has measurements marked on it and is used for measuring the length or height of something
to record somebody/something on magnetic tape using a special machine
examples: Private conversations between the two had been taped and sent to a newspaper.

meanings.def: to fasten something by sticking or tying it with tape
examples: Put it in a box and tape it up securely.
The lid was taped down to hold it in place.
The wires are taped firmly together.

meanings.def: to stick something onto something else using sticky tape
examples: Someone had taped a message on the door.

meanings.def: to tie a bandage (= a piece of cloth) around an injury or a wound
examples: That's a nasty cut—come on, we'll get it all taped up.

meanings.def: to understand somebody/something completely and to have learned how to deal with them/it successfully
examples: He can't fool me—I've got him taped.
It took me a while to learn the job, but I think I’ve got it taped now.

idioms.def: to understand somebody/something completely and to have learned how to deal with them/it successfully
examples: He can't fool me—I've got him taped.
It took me a while to learn the job, but I think I’ve got it taped now.
